intro: Hereroa glenensis, commonly known as the Glen's Hereroa, is a rare flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of numerous tiny florets. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in cool, moist environments. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, while its flowers are small and yellow, often arranged in dense clusters. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Hereroa glenensis is considered a vulnerable species.
